#### RIFT analysis: Cross-coherence
{{< lipsum 2 >}}

$$
C(f,t) = \left| \frac{1}{N} \sum_{n=1}^{N} \frac{Oz_n(f,t) \cdot PD_n^{*}(f,t)} {\left| Oz_n (f,t) \cdot PD_n^{*}(f,t) \right|} \right|
$${#eq-crosscoherence}

where:

 - $N$ is the number of trials.
 
 - $Oz_n(f,t)$ and $PD_n(f,t)$ represent the complex time-frequency coefficients of the EEG channel (here: $Oz$) and the photodiode channel ($PD$), respectively, at frequency $f$ and time $t$ for trial $n$.
 
 - $*$ denotes the complex conjugate.

(see @eq-crosscoherence.)
